metadata.title: CVE-2023-52887 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: can: j1939: enhanced error handling for tightly received RTS messagesin xtp_rx_rts_session_newThis patch enhances error handling in scenarios with RTS (Request toSend) messages arriving closely. It replaces the less informativeWARN_ON_ONCEbacktraces with a new error handling method. This provides clearer errormessages and allows for the early termination of problematic sessions.Previously, sessions were only released at the end of j1939_xtp_rx_rts().Potentially this could be reproduced with something like:testj1939 -r vcan0:0x80 &while true; do	# send first RTS	cansend vcan0 18EC8090#1014000303002301;	# send second RTS	cansend vcan0 18EC8090#1014000303002301;	# send abort	cansend vcan0 18EC8090#ff00000000002301;done

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-195-generic - 5.4.0-195.215~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-195-lowlatency - 5.4.0-195.215~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-195.215~18.04.1').
